snippet: The Islamic State, facing airstrikes, as well as demographics that do not favor expansion, is carrying out a less visible operation in some areas.
abstract: Analysts say that days of easy and rapid gains for Islamic State extremists may be coming to close in Iraq as group's momentum stalls; slowdown is thought to be result of multiple factors, including international airstrikes and unfavorable sectarian and political demographics.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kirk Semple, Falih Hassan and Omar al-Jawoshi.

lead_paragraph: The Islamic State, facing airstrikes, as well as demographics that do not favor expansion, is carrying out a less visible operation in some areas.

headline.main: ISIS Wave of Might Is Turning Into Ripple
headline.print_headline: ISIS Wave of Might Is Turning Into Ripple

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
